title.rendered: Stacey Abrams Campaign Releases First TV and Digital Ad

content.rendered:
ATLANTA — Today, the Abrams for Governor campaign launched its first TV and digital ad. The ad highlights how, after her 2018 campaign for governor, Stacey Abrams did not quit. Highlighting the work Abrams has done for Georgians over the past four years, the debut ad coincides with the launch of Abrams’ “One Georgia” tour stops yesterday in Cuthbert, Warner Robins and Atlanta. Upcoming tour stops will be held in Albany, Athens, Augusta, Columbus, Midway and Thomasville.

Says Abrams in the ad, “I got back to work. Paid off the medical debt of 68,000 Georgians. Helping small businesses stay alive by making sure they had the financing they needed. And putting money into the pockets of families.”


The ad, “Never Quit,” can be viewed here.

Script:

ABRAMS: In the last four years I’ve seen more Georgians face pain, face challenges…

When I didn’t win the Governor’s race, not getting the job didn’t exempt me from the work. And so, I didn’t quit.

I got back to work. Paid off the medical debt of 68,000 Georgians. Helping small businesses stay alive by making sure they had the financing they needed. And putting money into the pockets of families. Trying my best to make sure that every Georgian had access and opportunity.

I was raised that when you don’t get what you want, you don’t give up. You try again. You try because it’s how things get better, it’s how the world moves forward. I don’t quit because Georgians deserve leadership. And that’s what a leader does. That’s the job of governor.

I want one Georgia where everyone has the opportunity to rise together and everyone has the opportunity to thrive.

And now, let’s get the job done.

###
